main_definition: Currencies refer to the various forms of money used as a medium of exchange in different countries or regions, including their respective values relative to one another.

meanings_and_examples.definition: The monetary units that serve as legal tender within a specific country
meanings_and_examples.example: In the United States, the currency is the US Dollar (USD).

meanings_and_examples.definition: Exchange rates between different currencies which determine their relative values and facilitate international trade
meanings_and_examples.example: As of now, 1 Euro (EUR) is worth approximately 1.20 US Dollars (USD).

meanings_and_examples.definition: A diverse collection or assortment of different currencies across the globe
meanings_and_examples.example: An investor who owns a variety of currencies, such as Japanese Yen (JPY), Australian Dollar (AUD), and Swiss Franc (CHF).
